intro: Mokof dentata, commonly known as the toothed mokof, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves with distinct teeth along the edges, contributing to its common name. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Mokof dentata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
